t: CPSC Warns Consumers to Immediately Stop Using CEINOL Brand Bathroom Faucets Sold on Amazon.com Due to Dangerous Lead Exposure for Young Children | CPSC.gov
s: The faucets are sold by Chaozhoushibobangshejiyouxiangongsi, located in China, on Amazon.com for approximately $55 under Amazon seller name CEINOL-USA.

t: Amazon to shut down Stitch Fix competitor 'Prime Try Before You Buy'
s: January 10, 2025 - Amazon is discontinuing a service that let Prime members try on clothes, shoes and accessories, and only pay for the items they want to keep.

t: VFAUOSIT Brand Kitchen Faucets Recalled Due to Dangerous Lead Exposure for Young Children; Sold on Amazon.com by Whisper08 | CPSC.gov
s: Consumers should immediately stop using these faucets and contact Whisper08 about disposal and a refund. Consumers will need to provide a photograph of disposal and their order number to receive the refund. Whisper08 is contacting all known purchasers directly.Until these faucets can be replaced, ...

t: Amazon.com: Stitches Medical
s: Stitches Medical is a brand that specializes in perioperative, postoperative, and adaptive apparel. Products range from Mastectomy Recovery clothing and products, dialysis treatment clothing, and fart-filtering underwear. Stitches adaptive apparel is a perfect gift for patients in recovery ...

Testing Prime Wardrobe: Can Amazon's Stitch Fix competitor change the way we buy clothes? – GeekWire
s: May 4, 2018 - Can Amazon help me dress better? Is technology going to change the way we purchase clothes? And does GeekWire's Taylor Soper have a future in modeling? He set out to answer those questions with his latest adventure: a test-run of Amazon Prime Wardrobe.

t: Amazon’s new 'Buy for Me' feature helps customers find and buy products from other brands’ sites
s: April 3, 2025 - New beta feature allows customers to use their Amazon Shopping app to complete purchases from other brand retailer websites if Amazon doesn’t sell the item directly.

t: Amazon.com: medisana USA
Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 4 hours ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: You can now buy Canyon bikes on Amazon in the US as German brand becomes the first major bike manufacturer to list on the platform | Cyclingnews
